page.title: 16FARMING GENERAL OUTLINE
page.content: The land in the area is mostly{grass- {land,}with a small percentage of moorland, both of which are used for grazing. The majority of farms are dairy with few mixed or arable farms. Most dairy farms cover about 20 acres with 10-60 cows and have milking parlours able to deal with about 6 cows at a time. One exception is a farm covering 176 acres (an area previously farmed by 12 families) with 130 cows and a{computerised {milking parlour}for 16 cows. There is a mixed farm with poultry and flowers but the land is not suitable for large scale market garden crops and most crops are grown for animal feed. These include: wheat, barley, stubble turnips and kale. There is a stud farm specializing in{rare stallions,}a pig farm, one small nursery and many small-holdings.
